Registered Syrian refugees (995,512 in January 2018) are included in the tabulated figures. The number of non-registered Syrian refugees is estimed to be about 400,000.

Palestine refugees residing in camps (174,422 according to the mid-2017 census) are not included in above figures (click on detail button for break down). Furthermore, there are about 40,000 Palestinian refugees from Syria in Lebanon.

Migration of Lebanese are not considered by the tabulated figures.

The actual total end-of-2017 population was – using these numbers – about 6.05 million.

In August 2017 the Lebanese parliament declared a new governorate Keserwan-Jbeil to be split from Mount Lebanon; capital will become Jounieh; 2017 population: 282,222.

(1970) Britannica Book of the Year 1990.

(1996) Lebanon State of the Environment Report, Ministry of Environment, Lebanese Republic (web).

(2007) (2011) (2017) Ministry of Public Health, Lebanese Republic (web).

(2017) also: UNHCR (web).
